alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 6:29PM MST until August 21 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY NEAR TUBA CITY... At 618 PM MST, Rain had ended across the warned area...but dangerously high water will still be within area washes and streams. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tuba City, Moenave, Moenkopi, Hopi, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 312 and 342. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 474 and 497. State Route 264 between mile markers 322 and 337. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Narrow Wash, Fivemile Wash, Bitter Spring Wash, Moenkopi Wash, Begashibito Wash and Hamblin Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
